intro: Otophora lancifolia, commonly known as the lancifoliate otophora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Otophora lancifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
